17.heading: Tardi, Jacques, 1946- --Miscellanea.
17.title: "Angoulême : Grandezza e Miserie delle BeDe"
17.author: Luigi Bernardi
notes: Report on the 12th Angoulême festival, Jan. 25-27, 1985). Lists four awards: The City of Angoulême award to Jacques Tardi, the Alfred for best album of the year to La Fièvre de Urbicande (Schuiten & Peters), and the best young author Alfred to Baru (for Quequettes Blues), and says the Alfred for best foreign album was not awarded.

74.title: "Le Tardía Evolución del Arte de la Historieta en Costa Rica"
74.author: Óscar Sierra Quintero
74.appears_in: p. 43-51 in La Revista Latinoamericana de Estudios sobre la Historieta, v. 2, no. 5 (Mar. 2002).
notes: Presented at the 7th Encuentro Internacional de Historietistas, Havana, Feb. 2002.

Resumen: "El trabajo hace una breve incursión en la historia del surgimiento de la historieta como expresión artística de los creadores ticos, y donde se fija la pobre y balbuceante evolución de la historieta nacional en Costa Rica para permitirnos conocer las limitadas obras y espacios con que ha contado y las acciones de publicación en que el propio autor ha tenido un papel protagónico."

Abstract: "This article makes a brief incursion into the history of the growth of the comics as an artistic expression of the ticos creators. The poor and intermittently coherent evolution of a national comics in Costa Rica is observed, showing the limited works and spaces in which it appears and the acts of publication in which the present author has been an instigator."
Abstracts as published with the article, with some editing of the English.

140.title: "Target of the Tarantula"
140.author: Cary Bates, script ; John Rosenberger, pencils ; Vince Colletta, inks
notes: In two parts, with part 2 titled "Lois Lane's Phantom Partner."
Summary: Someone posing as the old TV character Tarantula has been killing mob members. Lois discovers the identity of the Tarantula.
Appearances of Superman, the Masher Mob, Frank Lester, Mabel Lester, Simon Cross (a ghost) and Gerold Lester.
Data from Gene Reed, Lou Mazzella, Mike Nielsen et al. via Grand Comics Database.

142.title: The Blank in the Comics strip collection includes a file of one or more daily comic strips related to this keyword or topic. Call no.: PN6726 f.B55
142.author: [No author]

143.heading: Target Practice.
143.title: "New Schoolteacher"
143.author: John Wade Hampton
notes: SUMMARY: Cyclone leaves to meet the stage bringing the new schoolteacher, Sandy Waters. Hoot Bowdrie and his gang ride into town and plan to use Midge for target practice. The sheriff rides to get Cyclone, who comes back and rescues Midge. Hoot Bowdrie hijacks the arriving stage and Cyclone then rescues it, and the schoolteacher too.

"Copr. 1942 by R.S. Callender". I. Hampton, John Wade. I. Cyclone. k. Stagecoaches. k. Schoolteachers. k. Teachers. k. Waters, Sandy. k. Bowdrie, Hoot. k. Midge. k. Target practice. k. Sheriffs. k. Rescues. k. Hijacking. Call no.: PN6728.1.D4P6no.83

156.title: Target Comics
notes:
Anthology style comic book. Features include
  • Al T. Tude (issues 27-44, 54, 57 = v. 3, no. 3 to v. 6, no. 1)
  • Bull's-Eye Bill (most issues, 1-100 = v. 1, no. 1 to v. 9, no. 10)
  • The Cadet (issues 15-105 = v. 2, no. 3 to v. 10, no. 3)
  • Calling 2R (issues 1-14 = v. 1, no. 1 to v. 2, no. 2)
  • Candid Charlie (most issues, 45-105 = v. 4, no. 9 to v. 10, no. 3)
  • The Chameleon (most issues, 6-101 - v. 1, no. 6 to v. 9 no. 11)
  • City Editor (issues 1-5 = v. 1 no. 1 to v. 1 no. 5)
  • Dan'l Flannel (most issues, 35-104 = v. 3 no. 11 to v. 10, no. 2)
  • Dink (issues 67-68, 90, 93, 99 = v. 7, no. 1 to v. 9, no. 9)
  • 18 Men and a Boat (issues 45-49 = v. 4, no. 9 to v. 5, no. 1)
  • Fantastic Feature Films (issues 1-39 = v. 1, no. 1 to v. 4, no. 3)
  • Gary Stark (issues 69-105 = v. 7, no. 3 - v. 10, no. 3)
  • Rip Rory (issues 1-4 = v. 1, no. 1 - v. 1, no. 4)
  • Spacehawk (issues 5-34 = v. 1, no. 5 to v. 3, no. 10)
  • Speck, Spot and Sis (most issues, 15-94 = v. 2, no. 3 to v. 9, no. 4)
  • Stories of the United Nations (issues 40-44, 60 = v. 4, no. 4 to v. 6, no. 4)
  • T-Men (issues 1-9 = v. 1, no. 1 - v. 1, no. 9)
  • The Target (most issues, 10-103 = v. 1, no. 10 - v. 10, no. 1)
  • The White Streak (issues 1-22 = v. 1, no. 1 to v. 2, no. 10)
This list originates from the one in Howard Keltner's Index to Golden Age Comic Books (Detroit, Mich. : J. Bails, 1976)
